official_title: A bill to prohibit increases in the wellhead prices of natural gas during the 6-month period beginning December 1, 1982.
short_title: Natural Gas Price Control Act of 1982

summary.text: Natural Gas Price Control Act of 1982 - Provides that the maximum lawful price applicable to the first sale delivery of any natural gas produced in the United States shall be the November 30, 1982, price applicable to such natural gas. Provides that, notwithstanding the terms of the Natural Gas Policy Act of 1978 or any contract, any price increase subject to this Act shall not be effective following the expiration of the control period. Defines control period as the period beginning December 1, 1982, and ending May 31, 1983. Directs the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to prescribe regulations which assure that the reductions in the costs which (but for this Act) would be borne by natural gas purchasers shall be passed through to such purchasers.

titles.title: Natural Gas Price Control Act of 1982
A bill to prohibit increases in the wellhead prices of natural gas during the 6-month period beginning December 1, 1982.
